docs.text: Welcome to My Dummy Site This is a simple MkDocs site deployed using GitHub Actions. About This Project This project demonstrates how to: - Create a static documentation site using MkDocs. - Automate build and deployment with GitHub Actions. - Host the site on GitHub Pages. Why MkDocs? MkDocs is a fast, simple, and beautiful static site generator that's geared towards building project documentation. It uses Markdown files for content and a YAML configuration for navigation. Features Easy Setup : Just write Markdown files. Custom Themes : Choose from built-in themes or create your own. GitHub Pages Integration : Deploy your site automatically. How It Works Write your documentation in Markdown. Configure navigation in mkdocs.yml . Push changes to GitHub. GitHub Actions builds and deploys your site to GitHub Pages. Next Steps Add more pages under the docs/ folder. Customize the theme in mkdocs.yml . Add a custom domain for your site. Would you like me to also create additional pages like: - getting-started.md (how to set up MkDocs) - workflow-guide.md (explaining the GitHub Actions workflow) - custom-domain.md (steps for adding a custom domain)
docs.title: Home
